Sentencas: The commercialization of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) that run on liquid hydrocarbon fuels is hindered by the poor coking tolerance of the state-of-the-art anode.
Titulo: Self-hydrating of a ceria-based catalyst enables efficient operation of solid oxide fuel cells on liquid fuels

Sentencas: Among the strategies developed, modulating the reforming reaction site's local steam/carbon ratios to enhance the coking tolerance is efficient but challenging.
Titulo: Self-hydrating of a ceria-based catalyst enables efficient operation of solid oxide fuel cells on liquid fuels

Sentencas: Here we report our rational design of a ceria-based catalyst (with a nominal composition of Ce0.95Ru0.05O2-d, CR5O) that demonstrates remarkable tolerance to coking while maintaining excellent activity for direct utilization of liquid fuels in SOFCs.
Titulo: Self-hydrating of a ceria-based catalyst enables efficient operation of solid oxide fuel cells on liquid fuels

Sentencas: Under operating conditions, the catalyst is trans-formed to a partially reduced oxide frame covered with Ru nanoparticles (Ru/Ce0.95Ru0.05-xO2-d, Ru/CR5-xO), as confirmed by experimental analyses.
Titulo: Self-hydrating of a ceria-based catalyst enables efficient operation of solid oxide fuel cells on liquid fuels

Sentencas: The Ru/CR5-xO demonstrates excellent self -hydration capability to remove the coke.
Titulo: Self-hydrating of a ceria-based catalyst enables efficient operation of solid oxide fuel cells on liquid fuels

Sentencas: When applied to the Ni-yttria-stabilized zirconia (Ni-YSZ) anode of an SOFC with liquid fuels, the catalyst enables excellent performance, achieving a peak power density of 1.010 W cm-2 without coking for-200 h operation (on methanol) at 750 degrees
Titulo: Self-hydrating of a ceria-based catalyst enables efficient operation of solid oxide fuel cells on liquid fuels

Sentencas: C. Furthermore, density functional theory calculations reveal that the high activity and coking tolerance of the Ru/CR5-xO catalyst-coated Ni-YSZ anode is attributed to the reduced energy barrier for the rate-limiting step and the formation of a COH intermediate for rapid carbon removal.(c) 2023 Science China Press.
Titulo: Self-hydrating of a ceria-based catalyst enables efficient operation of solid oxide fuel cells on liquid fuels

Sentencas: Published by Elsevier B.V. and Science China Press.
Titulo: Self-hydrating of a ceria-based catalyst enables efficient operation of solid oxide fuel cells on liquid fuels
